C&W MARKET BEAT 2023 ‚Äì HOTEL INVESTMENT IN EUROPE A strong final quarter saw European hotel transactions reach nearly ‚Ç¨17 billion last year, according to new data from Cushman & Wakefield. During the year, 787 properties were sold, comprising 106,000 rooms worth EUR 16.9 billion. This remains significantly below 2019 levels but is only 4% short of the 2022 total. In the last quarter, volumes reached ‚Ç¨5.4 billion, a 13% increase relative to Q4 2022 (‚Ç¨4.8 billion). Several major individual deals drove these volumes, including the sale of the Westin Paris Vendome, the Center Parcs Allg√§u in Germany, the Six Senses Hotel Rome, the Mandarin Oriental and Hotel Sofia in Barcelona, and Haymarket House in London (office to hotel conversion). To learn more, download our Market Beat Europe 2023 here: https://lnkd.in/dG64rF3d For further information and support with your hotel real estate in Europe, contact our experts Jonathan Hubbard, Le Fichoux Frederic, Ed Fitch, Katell Bourgeois, Bruno Hall√© Boix, Albert Grau - MRICS, Gon√ßalo Garcia, Alessandro Belli, David Nath MRICS, Josef Filser, Borivoj Vokrinek or contact us at HospitalityEMEA@CushWake.com #CWHospitality #HotelInvestment #HotelRealEstate #EuropeHotels

This is an excellent property. ST Clair developed it originally as a hotel and I got to tour the property with him . It didn‚Äôt get to open as a hotel, yet under Marriott and Las Brisas it should be a success. It‚Äôs a great location just two minutes walk to the isla verde beach. It‚Äôs close to hotels üè® and restaurants . They will probably need more parking but There‚Äôs alternatives close by. üü°There are other hotels üè® for sale and buildings that are prime for conversion to hotels, apartments or short term rentals. There are local tax credits of 30-40% of the investment that it could qualify for. If you‚Äôre interested in investing in such properties DM me for information. #investinginrealestate #hotelinvestment #shorttermrentals #puertoricorealestate

Where‚Äôs the New York City Hotel Market? Apparently showing ongoing signs of recovery‚Ä¶ 1 Hotel Central Park sold yesterday for just above $1 million per key. According to New York City sales records from 2023 and 2024, upper-end hotels (Mondrian, The William Vale, and 1 Hotel Central Park) are trading between $800K and $1 million per room. Mid-market properties (like Hampton Inn, Hilton Garden Inn, and Doubletree) ranged from $400K to $600K per room. Distressed sales (the Roger Smith, Row NYC) were around $200K per key. Is the landscape shifting? What are your thoughts? #NewYork #Hotel #Hospitality #RealEstate #PrivateEquity
